transcript.title: UNKNOWN
transcript.content:
PRIME MINISTER
FOR MEDIA 23 MAY 1991
I am very saddened to learn of the death of Manning Clark.
A great Australian, Manning Clark's contribution to the
knowledge and understanding by Australians of their own
country and themselves will stand as a lasting monument to
his intellect, scholarship and dedication.
His " A History of Australia" will remain for many years as
an invaluable reference point for all Australians who seek
to learn about the forces, struggles and events which have
shaped the Australia of the 1990s and beyond.
I extend my deepest sympathy to his wife Dymphnat and his
family.
